text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 25px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer; fill-opacity: 1;

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: Given a point O in a plane and a positive number r, the set of points in the plane that are a distance of r units
from O is called a circle

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: The diameter of the circle is twice the radius

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: The distance around a circle is called the circumference of the circle,
The ratio of the circumference Cnto the diameter d is the same for all circles and
is denoted by the Greek letter π ; that is

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 25px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 25px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;

-webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: The value of π is approximately 3.14 and can also be approximated by the fraction 22/7

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 15px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;
text.tspan: If r is the radius , then C/d = C/2r = π and so the circumference is related to the radius by the equation

text.style: -webkit-tap-highlight-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0); text-anchor: middle; font-style: normal; font-variant: normal; font-weight: normal; font-size: 25px; line-height: normal; font-family: Georgia; cursor: pointer;

text.tspan: The area of a circle with radius r is equal to
